TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HyperLink extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl

Docs.summary: A control that displays a link to another Web page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In this topic: - [Introduction](#introduction) - [Accessibility](#accessibility) - [Declarative Syntax](#declarative_syntax) ## Introduction Use the control to create a link to another Web page. The control is typically displayed as text specified by the property. It can also be displayed as an image specified by the property. If both the and properties are set, the property takes precedence. If the image is unavailable, the text in the property is displayed. In browsers that support ToolTip functionality, the property also becomes the ToolTip. > [!CAUTION] > This control can be used to display user input, which might include malicious client script. Check any information that is sent from a client for executable script, SQL statements, or other code before displaying it in your application. ASP.NET provides an input request validation feature to block script and HTML in user input. Validation server controls are also provided to assess user input. For more information, see [Validation Server Control Syntax](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/96d2c59e-693c-4079-9b53-b3ff0d9e9133). ## Accessibility For information about how to configure this control so that it generates markup that conforms to accessibility standards, see [Accessibility in Visual Studio and ASP.NET](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/7e3ce9c4-6b7d-4fb1-94b5-72cf2a44fe13) and [ASP.NET Controls and Accessibility](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/847a37e3-ce20-41da-b0d3-7dfb0fdae9a0). ## Declarative Syntax ``` ``` ## Examples The following example demonstrates how to create a control on a Web page that links to another Web page. [!code-aspx-csharp[Classic HyperLink.NavigateUrl Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic HyperLink.NavigateUrl Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic HyperLink.NavigateUrl Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic HyperLink.NavigateUrl Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: protected override void AddParsedSubObject (object obj);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void AddParsedSubObject(object obj) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub AddParsedSubObject (obj As Object)
protected: override void AddParsedSubObject(System::Object ^ obj);
override this.AddParsedSubObject : obj -> unit

Docs.param: An that represents the parsed element.
Docs.summary: Notifies the control that an element was parsed, and adds the element to the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is used primarily by control developers, when deriving a custom control from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink> class.
If the input object is a <xref:System.Web.UI.LiteralControl>, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink> control has no child controls, then the input object is used to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink.Text%2A> property of the control. Otherwise, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.AddParsedSubObject%2A> method of the base <xref:System.Web.UI.Control> class is called and the specified object is added to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Controls%2A> collection.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink.AddParsedSubObject%2A> method in a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink> server control so that it always sets the text property to the parsed object's text property, if the parsed object is a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Literal>, and to an empty string otherwise.
[!code-aspx-csharp[CustomHyperLinkAddParsedSubObject#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/CustomHyperLinkAddParsedSubObject/CS/custom_hyperlink_addparsedsubobjectcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[CustomHyperLinkAddParsedSubObject#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/CustomHyperLinkAddParsedSubObject/VB/custom_hyperlink_addparsedsubobjectvb.aspx#1)]
[!code-csharp[CustomHyperLinkAddParsedSubObject#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/CustomHyperLinkAddParsedSubObject/CS/custom_hyperlink_addparsedsubobject.cs#2)] [!code-vb[CustomHyperLinkAddParsedSubObject#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/CustomHyperLinkAddParsedSubObject/VB/custom_hyperlink_addparsedsubobject.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string ImageUrl { get; set; }
.property instance string ImageUrl
Public Overridable Property ImageUrl As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ ImageUrl { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.ImageUrl : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the path to an image to display for the control.
Docs.value: The path to the image to display for the control. The default value is an empty string ("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink> control can be displayed as text or an image. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink.ImageUrl%2A> property to specify an image to display for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink> control.
> [!NOTE] > If both the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink.Text%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink.ImageUrl%2A> properties are set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink.ImageUrl%2A> property takes precedence. If the image is unavailable, the text in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink.Text%2A> property is displayed. In browsers that support ToolTip functionality, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink.Text%2A> property also becomes the ToolTip.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink.ImageUrl%2A> property to specify the path to the image to display.
[!code-aspx-csharp[Classic HyperLink.NavigateUrl Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic HyperLink.NavigateUrl Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic HyperLink.NavigateUrl Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic HyperLink.NavigateUrl Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool SupportsDisabledAttribute { get; }
.property instance bool SupportsDisabledAttribute
Public Overrides ReadOnly Property SupportsDisabledAttribute As Boolean
public: virtual property bool SupportsDisabledAttribute { bool get(); };
member this.SupportsDisabledAttribute : bool

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the control should set the attribute of the rendered HTML element to "disabled" when the control's property is .
Docs.value: if the property indicates an ASP.NET version lower than 4.0; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property indicates how ASP.NET should render HTML for a control when the control is disabled. If this property is `true`, ASP.NET renders a `disabled` attribute when a control is disabled. If this property is `false`, ASP.NET renders a `class` attribute when a control is disabled. For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.SupportsDisabledAttribute%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

MemberSignature.Value: public string Target { get; set; }
.property instance string Target
Public Property Target As String
public: property System::String ^ Target { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Target : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the target window or frame in which to display the Web page content linked to when the control is clicked.
Docs.value:
The target window or frame to load the Web page linked to when the control is clicked. Values must begin with a letter in the range of a through z (case-insensitive), except for the special values listed in the following table, which begin with an underscore.
Renders the content in a new window without frames.
Renders the content in the immediate frameset parent.
Renders the content in the search pane.
Renders the content in the frame with focus.
Renders the content in the full window without frames.
Check your browser documentation to determine if the value is supported. For example, Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.0 and later support the target value.
The default value is an empty string ("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink.Target%2A> property to specify the frame or window that displays the Web page linked to when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink> control is clicked. The Web page is specified by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink.NavigateUrl%2A> property.
If this property is not set, the browser or window with focus refreshes when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink> control is clicked.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink.Target%2A> property renders as a `target` attribute. The `target` attribute on `anchor` elements is not allowed in the XHTML 1.1 document type definition. Do not set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink.Target%2A> property if the rendered output for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink> must be XHTML 1.1 compliant. For more information, refer to the topic [XHTML Standards in Visual Studio and ASP.NET](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/1b78d416-66bb-43a5-ac77-c703aab55b97). > > When creating accessible Web pages, it is strongly recommended you avoid using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink.Target%2A> property to target another window. For more information, see [Accessibility in Visual Studio and ASP.NET](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/7e3ce9c4-6b7d-4fb1-94b5-72cf2a44fe13) and [ASP.NET Controls and Accessibility](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/847a37e3-ce20-41da-b0d3-7dfb0fdae9a0).
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink.Target%2A> property to specify the window or frame to display the page associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink> control.
[!code-aspx-csharp[Classic HyperLink.Target Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic HyperLink.Target Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic HyperLink.Target Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic HyperLink.Target Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)]

member this.Text : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text caption for the control.
Docs.value: The text caption for the control. The default value is an empty string ("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink> control can be displayed as text or an image. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink.Text%2A> property to specify the text to display for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink> control.
If both the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink.Text%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink.ImageUrl%2A> properties are set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink.ImageUrl%2A> property takes precedence. If the image is unavailable, the text in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink.Text%2A> property is displayed. In browsers that support ToolTip functionality, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink.Text%2A> property also becomes the ToolTip.
> [!CAUTION] > This control can be used to display user input, which might include malicious client script. Check any information that is sent from a client for executable script, SQL statements, or other code before displaying it in your application. ASP.NET provides an input request validation feature to block script and HTML in user input. Validation server controls are also provided to assess user input. For more information, see [Validation Server Control Syntax](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/96d2c59e-693c-4079-9b53-b3ff0d9e9133).
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool. For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink.Text%2A> property to specify the text to display for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HyperLink> control.
[!code-aspx-csharp[Classic HyperLink.Text Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic HyperLink.Text Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic HyperLink.Text Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic HyperLink.Text Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)]
